lines.gurmukhi: purK inpuMsk n jwny binqw iblws bwNJ khw jwny suK sMqq snyh kau
lines.transliteration_english: Purakh Nipounsak N Jaanay Banitaa Bilaasa , Baanjh Kahaa Jaanay Soukh Santat Sanayh Kau ?

Shabad OS B.translation: Just as an impotent person does not know what pleasure it is to share a union with a woman, and a barren woman cannot know the love and attachment of children.

lines.gurmukhi: ginkw sMqwn ko bKwn khw goqcwr nwh aupcwr kCu kustI kI dyh kau
lines.transliteration_english: Ganikaa Santaan Ko Bakhaan Kahaa Gotachaara , Naah Oupachaar Kachhu Kousatee Kee Dayh Kau ?

Shabad OS B.translation: Just as the lineage of the children of a prostitute cannot be defined, and a leper cannot be cured anyway.

lines.gurmukhi: AwNDro n jwnY rUp rMg n dsn Cib jwnq n bhro pRsMn AspRyh kau
lines.transliteration_english: Aandharo N Jaanai Roop Rang N Dasan Chhabi , Jaanat N Baharo Prasann Asaprayh Kau ?

Shabad OS B.translation: Just as a blind person cannot know the beauty of the face and teeth of a woman and a deaf person cannot feel anyone's anger or happiness since he cannot hear.

lines.gurmukhi: Awn dyv syvk n jwny gurdyv syv jYsy qau jvwso nhI cwhq hY myh kau ]443]
lines.transliteration_english: Aan Dayv Sayvak N Jaanay Gurdayv Sayva , Jaisay Tau Javaaso Nahee Chaahat Hai Mayh Kau ?443?

Shabad OS B.translation: Similarly, a devotee and follower of other gods and goddesses, cannot know the celestial bliss of service of true and perfect Guru. Just as camel-thorn (Alhagi maurorum) resents rain.  (443)
